channel.title: How do you make pickup allow 5 digit ID's? (e.g ::pickup 15800 1)

item.title: How do you make pickup allow 5 digit ID's? (e.g ::pickup 15800 1)
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

You can have 20000 and 30000.It doesn’t really matter.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make pickup allow 5 digit ID's? (e.g ::pickup 15800 1)
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Jp Owner Jp
item.description:
@Owner_Jp wrote:

easy. Jordie, See where it says

 if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >=0) {

Change to if newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >=0_ {
Just change to 30000. Its that easy… There’s a Stickied topic on it about turning server to silabs, has pickup. But turning to 30000 WILL work.

Read full topic

if cmd is pickup5digit item additem5digititem send msg hi
[/quote][/quote]

item.title: How do you make pickup allow 5 digit ID's? (e.g ::pickup 15800 1)
item.dc:creator: @strengthxlx strengthxlx
item.description:
@strengthxlx wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! "); } }

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make pickup allow 5 digit ID's? (e.g ::pickup 15800 1)
item.dc:creator: @o_b_b_y_k_o o b b y k o
item.description:
@o_b_b_y_k_o wrote:

Title says it. I just can’t figure it out. In the pickup code, there is nothing that counts digits. All I can figure out is that it may be the substrings. Here is my code:

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Mod Steve") || playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 20000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 999999999"); }

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make pickup allow 5 digit ID's? (e.g ::pickup 15800 1)
